lines.text: Someday, I'm going to take a ten pound sledge to that pipe... and I hope it's in your mouth when I do.
I've been waiting for you to try that for twenty-two years, you miserable Irish polecat.
You can't fire me, I quit two hours ago!
I guess old Smokestack's right this time. We've handled these diploma boys before, you know. He'll learn soon enough to stay out of our way.
Well... alright. But you've got to promise me one thing. If this man turns out to be impossible, we're leaving. I'm not go to let anyone push you around.
Have you ever seen anyone push me around... except you and your mother?
Yeah, with the sheriff. They need a new one now.
It looks like we're already in the war everybody keeps talking about.
No, this is worse than war. In a war, at least you know who you're fighting.
What's the sense in worrying about something that might not happen?
Well, if we worry enough maybe it won't happen.
